intro: Pimpinella caffra, commonly known as African cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Pimpinella caffra is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is known for its aromatic properties. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
